questions.question: What are the three distinct phases observed in the study of X-pcu-3-Zn-3i?
questions.answer: The three distinct phases observed are the as-synthesized α phase, a denser-activated β phase, and a shape-memory γ phase.

questions.question: How does the density of X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-α compare to X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-β?
questions.answer: X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-α has a lower density (1.046 g/cm3) compared to X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-β (1.333 g/cm3).

questions.question: What triggers the transformation from X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-β to X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-γ?
questions.answer: The transformation is triggered by gas adsorption, specifically by CO2 at 195 K, N2 at 77 K, and CO at 82 K.

questions.question: Is the shape-memory phase X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-γ reversible, and if so, how can it be reverted to its original phase?
questions.answer: Yes, X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-γ is reversible and can revert to the β phase when heated at >400 K under vacuum or to the α phase by soaking in DMF.

questions.question: What role does interpenetration play in the stability of the shape-memory phase of X-pcu-3-Zn-3i?
questions.answer: Interpenetration enables framework-framework interactions that stabilize the less dense shape-memory phase.

questions.question: True or False: The shape-memory effect in X-pcu-3-Zn-3i is observed only with CO2 adsorption.
True or False: The density of X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-γ is intermediate between that of X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-α and X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-β.
What experimental techniques were used to study the phase transformations in X-pcu-3-Zn-3i?
questions.answer: Single-crystal X-ray diffraction (SCXRD), gas sorption, in situ variable temperature/pressure powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD), and molecular modeling were used.

questions.question: How does the guest accessible volume change from X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-α to X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-β?
questions.answer: The guest accessible volume decreases from 46% in X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-α to 15% in X-pcu-3-Zn-3i-β.

questions.question: True or False: The shape-memory effect in X-pcu-3-Zn-3i is a result of chemical reactions within the framework.
What is the role of the extended ligands (X ligands) in the flexibility of X-pcu-3-Zn-3i?
questions.answer: Extended ligands (X ligands) can distort more readily than shorter ligands, contributing to the framework's flexibility and enabling the shape-memory effect.

questions.question: True or False: X-pcu-3-Zn-3i exhibits a shape-memory effect under the influence of multiple sorbates.
What factors are expected to facilitate a kinetically stable shape-memory FMOM according to the study?
questions.answer: Framework flexibility induced by sorbent-sorbate interactions, interpenetration enabling framework-framework interactions, and reduced strain in the MBBs and linkers in the shape-memory phase.
